org.nerd4j.csv.conf.mapping.ann

Annotation Type CSVParser


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=ANNOTATION_TYPE)
public @interface CSVParser
    Creates a CSVParser using the annotated JavaBean to retrieve the required configurations.

    Usage

    The CSVParser annotation is intended to be used inside the following annotations:

    • CSVReader.

    This annotation is equivalent to the XML configuration csv:parser.

    Author:
    Nerd4j Team

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      char fieldSep
      Character used to separate fields in the CSV source.
      char quote
      Character used to quote fields.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      char[] charsToIgnore
      Set of characters to be completely ignored while parsing.
      char[] charsToIgnoreAroundFields
      Set of characters to be ignored if found on heading or trailing of a field.
      char escape
      Character used to escape other characters.
      char[] recordSep
      Characters used to separate records in the CSV source.
      boolean recordSepMatchExactSequence
      Tells the strategy to use for match a record separator.
      boolean strictQuotes
      Tells to treat CSV quotes strictly.

    • Element Detail

      • quote

        public abstract char quote
        Character used to quote fields.

        The character used by default is the double quote ["].

        Returns:
        character used to quote fields.

      • fieldSep

        public abstract char fieldSep
        Character used to separate fields in the CSV source.

        The character used by default is the comma [,].

        Returns:
        character used to separate fields.

      • strictQuotes

        public abstract boolean strictQuotes
        Tells to treat CSV quotes strictly. More precisely tells the parser to fail in case a not escaped quote is found into a field.
        Returns:
        true if quotes should be treated strictly.
        Default:
        false

      • escape

        public abstract char escape
        Character used to escape other characters.

        There is no default values for this feature.

        Returns:
        character used to escape other characters.
        Default:
        65535

      • recordSep

        public abstract char[] recordSep
        Characters used to separate records in the CSV source.

        By default the operating system line separator will be used.

        Returns:
        the character used as record separator.
        Default:
        65535

      • recordSepMatchExactSequence

        public abstract boolean recordSepMatchExactSequence
        Tells the strategy to use for match a record separator.

        If true matches the exact character sequence provided in the recordSep() field.

        By default it will match a record separator as soon as it finds any record separator character (this is the behavior implemented by Microsoft Excel and OpenOffice Calc).

        Returns:
        true if the exact sequence is used to match record separator.
        Default:
        false

      • charsToIgnore

        public abstract char[] charsToIgnore
        Set of characters to be completely ignored while parsing.

        There is no default values for this feature.

        Returns:
        set of characters to ignore.
        Default:
        65535

      • charsToIgnoreAroundFields

        public abstract char[] charsToIgnoreAroundFields
        Set of characters to be ignored if found on heading or trailing of a field.

        The characters ignored by default are:

        • space [ ];
        • horizontal tab [\t];
        • new line feed [\n].
        Returns:
        set of characters to ignore around fields.
        Default:
        65535
